text: I'm searching for an elegant way to convert a normal Python dict with some nested dicts to an object.
Should be accessible in this way:

code:
>>> x = dict2obj(d)
>>> x.a
1
>>> x.b.c
2
>>> x.d[1].foo
bar

text: I think, this is not possible without recursion, but what would be a nice way to get an objectstyle for dicts?

Thank you in advance,
cheers Marc
